summary: how do people know the actual amounts people filmed like these assumptions about sophie not filming at all seem baseless to me...
question: how do people know the actual amounts people filmed like these assumptions about sophie not filming at all seem baseless to me but they must be getting their “info” somewhere
answer: Sightings. Game of Thrones has several filming locations and if an actor is seen in those areas then they’re filming. We knew Tyrion was with Dany in season 5 because Peter was seen near the Meereen set/location. Then people guess how long the actors are on location.

reblog.comment: Sightings. Game of Thrones has several filming locations and if an actor is seen in those areas then they’re filming. We knew Tyrion was with Dany in season 5 because Peter was seen near the Meereen set/location. Then people guess how long the actors are on location.

trail.content_raw: Sightings. Game of Thrones has several filming locations and if an actor is seen in those areas then they’re filming. We knew Tyrion was with Dany in season 5 because Peter was seen near the Meereen set/location. Then people guess how long the actors are on location.

summary: Most Anticipated TV Shows
title: Most Anticipated TV Shows
body:
Most Anticipated TV Shows

So far, 2019 has delivered some incredible TV hits. My most anticipated for the start of the year was Titans and The Umbrella Academy and they did not disappoint. With the popularity of streaming services at an all-time high, it seems we have more choices than ever in TV and film. This list comprises of TV shows that are set to be released and will undoubtedly have me glueded to the edge of my…

View On WordPress

summary: omg this filming nonsense. reminds me of some jonerys folks who still claim that sophie didn't film in spain but was there for...
question: omg this filming nonsense. reminds me of some jonerys folks who still claim that sophie didn't film in spain but was there for some documentary about the show (like lmao) and STILL sure she dies in ep.3. i didn't pay so close attention on filming shedule but it seems emilia was filming as much as sophie, wich is rather weird for a battle involved character.
answer: They’re not a smart bunch, we know that. They genuinely believe any leak that comes from r/freefolk when it’s impossible. They don’t track Sophie’s filming schedule well. I know some people who think she finished in 2017.

reblog.comment: They’re not a smart bunch, we know that. They genuinely believe any leak that comes from r/freefolk when it’s impossible. They don’t track Sophie’s filming schedule well. I know some people who think she finished in 2017.

summary: Game Of Thrones Season 8: Viserys Targaryen Actor Weighs In On Who Should Win The Throne
title: Game Of Thrones Season 8: Viserys Targaryen Actor Weighs In On Who Should Win The Throne
excerpt: Harry Lloyd, who played Daenerys's abusive brother way back in Season 1, also told us his favorite series death (besides his own).
description:
As Game of Thrones Season 8’s April 14 premiere date quickly approaches, one question dominates all others: Who will sit on the Iron Throne when all is said and done? This is the show’s final season, after all, and unlike George R.R. Martin’s forever-in-progress books, the HBO production will actually have a conclusion.

We had that all-consuming question in mind when we recently got the chance to sit down with Harry Lloyd, who’s set to play Charles Xavier–Professor X–in the third and final season of FX’s X-Men adaptation Legion. Game of Thrones fans, however, will probably know Lloyd better as Viserys Targaryen, Daenerys’s abusive brother from back in Game of Thrones Season 1.

Lloyd couched his opinion in the fact that he’s “not quite up to date, shamefully,” though he plans to catch up before Season 8 arrives. But his nomination for Ruler of the Seven Kingdoms, King or Queen of Westeros, and Warmer of the Iron Throne is nevertheless perfectly valid: nobody.

“I kind of want no one on it, to be honest,” the actor said, grinning. “I just want it to become a really nice, kind of democracy.”

He did offer one more alternative, though: “I’ll tell you what, I always wanted Hodor to be in charge,” he continued, laughing–clearly aware of the character’s fate in Season 6. “But, yeah–maybe with some time travel?”

With this line of questioning begun, we couldn’t stop at one. To this day, Viserys’s gruesome death at Khal Drogo’s hands in Season 1–with a pot of molten gold poured over his dome–stands as one of the show’s best. We asked Lloyd whether there’s been another since then that topped it. Surprisingly, he went all the way back to another Season 1 death.

“You know what one of my favorite deaths has always been, was just a couple of episodes after mine, in Episode 8 of Season 1, when Khal Drogo rips that guy’s tongue out,” Lloyd said. He remembered discussing the scene with Jason Momoa, who played Khal Drogo (and, of course, went on to portray Aquaman in Justice League and his own standalone movie). According to Lloyd, the scene was written as a more straightforward sword fight, but Momoa had other ideas.

Momoa apparently got involved personally, asking the art department to whip up a convincing tongue that looked like it had been ripped out root and stem. “And it’s Game of Thrones, so the art department, you know, they rustled one of them up–they probably had a couple already on file,” Lloyd recalled.

“I just thought that was a wonderful little sequence, and the fact that it was so collaborative,even in that first [season],” he continued, “I always liked that.”

summary: I think this is the third time I’ve seen an anon go to someone’s blog and mention Sophie’s apparent lack of filming. At first I...
question: I think this is the third time I’ve seen an anon go to someone’s blog and mention Sophie’s apparent lack of filming. At first I got a little nervous but considering that the first couple of episodes are probably going to be the war I’m not surprised—the way they described the battle filming it sounded intense, like one of their people actually fainted intense. But I really don’t believe that Sansa won’t have an important role to play going forward.
answer: They are trying to make sure we panic. I think Sansa will be prominent in the first few episodes before the Battle of Winterfell. I doubt she’ll be absent the entire episode. She’ll become prominent after it ends especially when the show returns to human conflict.

reblog.comment: They are trying to make sure we panic. I think Sansa will be prominent in the first few episodes before the Battle of Winterfell. I doubt she’ll be absent the entire episode. She’ll become prominent after it ends especially when the show returns to human conflict.

blog.name: blahblah-vampire-emergency-blah
blog.description: Sometimes your name rises unbidden from my lips when I least expect it

summary: My love for Sansa Stark is completely cemented on the rewatch of this show.  I understand that she is one of those characters...
body:
My love for Sansa Stark is completely cemented on the rewatch of this show. I understand that she is one of those characters that people hate more than like, but her character is so complex; she was stupidly in love with an ideal than the reality, watched her father beheaded after pleading mercy, presently shes a bird in a gilded cage subject to punishment on the whim of the King.

I will keep saying this, her strengths in the early seasons were pure survival with healthy doses of fear, while its not bluntly apparent she is starting to play the game through tiny baby steps of keeping her courtesies intact to stay alive.

There is one instance where she comes across as harsh in her behaviour towards Shae and I understand its only a cry for some control of her life even if she is horrible about it (the scene segue’s from her at dinner with Cersei and her children and talks of her brothers possible death, being married to Joff). As stated I understand her behaviour but it doesn’t mean I condone her treatment of Shae in this instance.

I will keep saying this, her strengths in the early seasons were pure survival with healthy doses of fear, while its not bluntly apparent she is starting to play the game through tiny baby steps of keeping her courtesies intact to stay alive.

There is one instance where she comes across as harsh in her behaviour towards Shae and I understand its only a cry for some control of her life even if she is horrible about it (the scene segue’s from her at dinner with Cersei and her children and talks of her brothers possible death, being married to Joff). As stated I understand her behaviour but it doesn’t mean I condone her treatment of Shae in this instance.
trail.content:
My love for Sansa Stark is completely cemented on the rewatch of this show. I understand that she is one of those characters that people hate more than like, but her character is so complex; she was stupidly in love with an ideal than the reality, watched her father beheaded after pleading mercy, presently shes a bird in a gilded cage subject to punishment on the whim of the King.

I will keep saying this, her strengths in the early seasons were pure survival with healthy doses of fear, while its not bluntly apparent she is starting to play the game through tiny baby steps of keeping her courtesies intact to stay alive.

There is one instance where she comes across as harsh in her behaviour towards Shae and I understand its only a cry for some control of her life even if she is horrible about it (the scene segue’s from her at dinner with Cersei and her children and talks of her brothers possible death, being married to Joff). As stated I understand her behaviour but it doesn’t mean I condone her treatment of Shae in this instance.
